thread.title: Razorbacks outlast Tigers in 4 OT thriller
thread.title_full: Razorbacks outlast Tigers in 4 OT thriller

title: Razorbacks outlast Tigers in 4 OT thriller
text:
Razorbacks outlast Tigers in 4 OT thriller FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (KTHV) – Today’s game was one for the ages. Post to Facebook Razorbacks outlast Tigers in 4 OT thriller FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (KTHV) – Today’s game was one for the ages.  //on.kthv.com/1LUKT3T   Join the Conversation To   Razorbacks outlast Tigers in 4 OT thriller Paul Hughes, THV11 3:54 p.m. CDT October 24, 2015 Oct 24, 2015; Fayetteville, AR, USA; Arkansas Razorbacks wide receiver Drew Morgan (80) dives into the end zone to score the winning touchdown during the quadruple overtime against the Auburn Tigers at Donald W. Reynolds Razorback Stadium. The Arkansas Razorbacks defeat the Auburn Tigers 54-46. Mandatory Credit: Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Jasen Vinlove, Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (KTHV) – Today’s game was one for the ages. 
The Arkansas Razorbacks (3-4, 2-2 SEC) outlasted the Auburn Tigers (4-3, 1-3 SEC) in the fourth overtime to win 54-46 on Saturday afternoon. 
The Hogs jumped out to the early lead scoring the first two touchdowns of the game with an 11-yard scamper by Dominique Reed in the first quarter and a 23-yard touchdown pass from Brandon Allen to Jeremy Sprinkle in the second quarter. Oct 24, 2015; Fayetteville, AR, USA; Arkansas Razorbacks wide receiver Dominique Reed (87) runs the ball in for a touchdown against the Auburn Tigers during the first half at Donald W. Reynolds Razorback Stadium. Reynolds Razorback Stadium. Reynolds Razorback Stadium.
